meanings.definition: The process of breaking something down into smaller parts or fragments.
meanings.sent1: The disintegration of the old building left rubble everywhere.
meanings.sent2: Over time, the disintegration of the rock formation created a pile of pebbles.
meanings.sent3: The disintegration of the cake made it impossible to serve at the party.
meanings.sent4: The disintegration of trust between them was like a bridge collapsing into the river below.
meanings.sent5: The disintegration of the paper in water was a slow and fascinating sight.

meanings.definition: The gradual decay or deterioration of something.
meanings.sent1: The disintegration of the old book's pages made it fragile to touch.
meanings.sent2: The disintegration of the wooden fence was evident from the peeling paint.
meanings.sent3: The disintegration of the ice cream cone left a sticky mess on the sidewalk.
meanings.sent4: The disintegration of the relationship was like watching a flower wilt in slow motion.
meanings.sent5: The disintegration of the leaf showed the passing of time through its fading colors.

meanings.definition: The act of separating or falling apart.
meanings.sent1: The disintegration of the puzzle pieces made it challenging to complete.
meanings.sent2: The disintegration of the team's unity led to their defeat in the game.
meanings.sent3: The disintegration of the cookie caused a crumb trail throughout the house.
meanings.sent4: The disintegration of the clouds signaled the arrival of a storm.
meanings.sent5: The disintegration of the sandcastle under the waves was a symbol of impermanence.
